definition: to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
